result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon M. Meating was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reminder Notice returned

Defendant Shannon M. Meating in court with attorney Shari L Post. Defendant Shannon M. Meating in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-280, 15CF-372 and 16CF-192.

9:02 AM Court calls cases.
Matters are before the Court on sentencing today.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court has received the PSI, completed by DOC and sent out to the parties.
Parties have received their copies.
State has no corrections to state for the record.
Atty Post has reviewed the PSI with her client, has a couple clarifications to point out, for the record.

Neither party wish to present evidence at this time.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing, appears on behalf of Atty Constable today, recommends prison and jail.
Atty Post addresses the Court prior to sentencing, recommends imposed/stayed sentence and probation.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CF-192:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for  11 years
Initial Confinement for 4 years
Extended Supervision for 7 years
114 days jail credit
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years
Conditions:
Pay Restitution of $6,791, Joint and Several with Joshua Todd
Obtain an assessment regarding drugs and alcohol and comply with any aftercare program
Obtain psychological assessment and take any prescriptions as prescribed
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Take medications as prescribed
All medications to be filled at one pharmacy
Sign necessary releases of information so agent can monitor
No Contact with William Need, Kurtz Weil Antiques, Grace Kulas, Jadeco Stamp and Hobby
Work if able
Participate in any other occupational therapy or counseling as recommended by the agent
Obtain HSED
Pay costs
Submit DNA Sample
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Restitution to be taken out at 25% of prison account
If no longer needed for evidence, the Defendant's phone may be returned

Count 2:
Determinate Prison Sentence for  5 years
Initial Confinement for 3 years
Extended Supervision for 2 years
114 days jail credit
Cncurrent to Count 1
Eligible for Substance abuse program after serving 2 years
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample
(Court will not impose the DNA Surcharge)

Count 6:
Determinate Prison Sentence for  5 years
Initial Confinement for 3 years
Extended Supervision for 2 years
114 days jail credit
Cncurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Eligible for Substance abuse program after serving 2 years
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample
(Court will not impose the DNA Surcharge)

15CF-280:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 30 days
64 Days Credit
Concurrent to 16CF-192
Pay costs
Court will not order Defendant to pay the DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge

Count 2:
Jail sentence for 30 days
64 Days Credit
Concurrent to Count 1
Concurrent to 16CF-192
Pay costs
Court wil not order Defendant to pay the DNA Surcharge

Defendant Shannon M. Meating in court with attorney Shari L Post. Defendant Shannon M. Meating in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion Hearing for bond reduction. Atty Post states reasons for motion. State objects to motion. BTC: Motion denied.
Sentencing hearing on August 19, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Shannon M. Meating in court with attorney Shari L Post. Defendant Shannon M. Meating in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF280 and 15CF372, and 16CF192. Amended Informations filed for 15CF372 and 15CF280. Waived reading. 
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF280 Guilty, 15CF372 Guilty, 16CF192 Ct 1, 2, & 6 Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF280, 15CF372, and 16CF192 ct 1, 2, & 6.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 
Statement of Read-Ins 14PT516.
